Package org.team639.robot.subsystems

Class Drivetrain

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.SendableBase
      • edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.command.Subsystem
        • org.team639.lib.subsystem.DriveSubsystem
          • org.team639.robot.subsystems.Drivetrain
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.Sendable, java.lang.AutoCloseable
    public class Drivetrain
extends DriveSubsystem
    The robot drivetrain hardware wrapper.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static class  Drivetrain.Mode
      Represents the possible modes that the drivetrain can be in.

      • display

        public final DrivetrainDisplay display

    • Constructor Detail

      • Drivetrain

        public Drivetrain​(com.ctre.phoenix.motorcontrol.can.TalonSRX leftMaster,
                  com.ctre.phoenix.motorcontrol.can.TalonSRX rightMaster,
                  com.ctre.phoenix.motorcontrol.IMotorController[] leftFollowers,
                  com.ctre.phoenix.motorcontrol.IMotorController[] rightFollowers,
                  com.kauailabs.navx.frc.AHRS navx,
                  LineFollower lineFollower)
        Creates a drivetrain with the given components.
        Parameters:
        leftMaster - The master motor on the left side.
        rightMaster - The master motor on the right side.
        leftFollowers - An array of following motor controllers on the left side.
        rightFollowers - An array of following motor controllers on the right side.
        navx - The robot navx.
        lineFollower - The line follower that is supposed to be mounted on the robot (It never was because no one left space for it).

        Takes two raw speed values and uses them to set the motors.
        Parameters:

        rSpeed - The value for the right side

      • initDefaultCommand

        protected void initDefaultCommand()
        Description copied from class: edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.command.Subsystem
        Initialize the default command for a subsystem By default subsystems have no default command, but if they do, the default command is set with this method. It is called on all Subsystems by CommandBase in the users program after all the Subsystems are created.
        Specified by:
        initDefaultCommand in class edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.command.Subsystem

      • getVisionTarget

        public java.util.Optional<VisionTarget> getVisionTarget()
        Returns an optional with the vision target information if one is detected, or empty otherwise. Worth noting that no vision was ever actually put on the robot.
        Returns:
        An optional with the vision target information if one is detected, or empty otherwise.
